snippet: In this semi-fictional book by Mr. Vila-Matas, an invitation to act as an installation piece at an exhibition in Germany begins a journey of revelations.
abstract: Valerie Miles reviews two books by Enrique Vila-Matas: A Brief History of Portable Literature, translated by Anne McLean and Thomas Bunstead, and The Illogic of Kassel, translated by Anne McLean and Anna Milsom.
lead_paragraph: In this semi-fictional book by Mr. Vila-Matas, an invitation to act as an installation piece at an exhibition in Germany begins a journey of revelations.

headline.print_headline: Revelations About Art and Life From a Chinese Restaurant in Germany
headline.main: Review: Enrique Vila-Matas Plots His Own Awakening in ‘The Illogic of Kassel’

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: A Brief History of Portable Literature (Book)
